audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker welcoming the audience to a "spookly video" and stating, "After many requests," he will discuss SCP-3008, which he likens to a backrooms level. A transition then occurs to what sounds like an explanation of the topic. He prompts the audience to "get into the explanation."

The clip starts with someone saying "okay" in a neutral tone, followed by the speaker delving into a description of something called "SCP 3008," referring to it as a "massive IKEA retail store," elaborating that it's a place with a lot of furniture, speaking in a slightly intrigued tone, explaining its object class as "Euclid" and its implications. The speaker then describes what happens when someone enters SCP 3008, emphasizing a transition into "SCP 3008-1" where the exit disappears, maintaining a tone of curious information delivery. The clip then transitions to someone saying "interesting" in a reflective tone.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, talking in a conversational tone about the interior of a building. He says it "looks like the inside of a regular Ikea," but is far larger than a normal store. He compares the interior size to "tents from Harry Potter" that are bigger on the inside and mentions that there are "no accurate measurements" of the IKEA, theorizing that the space might be infinite.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, delivering a descriptive summary in a factual and informative tone. He discusses area SCP-3008-1, its inhabitants, their civilizations, and the fortifications built to ward off a creature called SCP-3008-2.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing creatures, including details of their appearance and behavior such as "semi-humanoid creatures," "exaggerated," their attire of "IKEA worker uniforms" and that they are "aggressive at nighttime". The speaker talks in an informative tone. The speaker explains that people must "make the makeshift forts and stay together."

The audio begins with a man speaking in an explanatory tone, describing the "main area, 3008-1" as having a day-night cycle, though not with a sun but with lights in the ceiling. He continues, explaining that when the store closes, "3008-2s" become aggressive, yelling phrases like "the store is closing" despite not having mouths, which he finds creepy. After saying they are passive during daytime, a background noise of indistinct speech comes in. He reiterates that they will attack back if provoked, ending with the word "listen".

The audio clip features a single male speaker describing "SCP 3008-1", an infinite Ikea, emphasizing that its exits are constantly changing. He notes that since containment procedures began, 14 people have escaped, had their minds wiped, and been released. The speaker's tone is informative.

The audio clip begins with one male speaker narrating a scary story that occurred on a "redacted day". He talks of a guy trapped inside of Ikea escaping back to the storefront, with an SCP shortly exiting and killing the guy. He concludes that this is the only recorded instance that a 3008-2 has escaped the infinite Ikea area. His tone is one of suspense and curiosity.

The clip begins with a male speaker setting up a story about a deceased individual who documented their time in IKEA. He clarifies that he won't read all the logs due to their length, but encourages listeners to check them out. His speaking tone is conversational and slightly ominous. He then states he will share an intriguing entry.

The audio clip starts with a single male speaker sharing thoughts on a dinner conversation. He notes that the conversation topics made everyone down, because people missed family, husbands, wives, kids, dogs and someone named Franklin has a pet llama. He then transitions to commenting on some people's lack of knowledge of the International Space Station, a former prime minister, and the Statue of Liberty. He expresses that this led him to wonder if everyone is from different dimensions or realities, which would explain why no one is looking for the missing people. He attributes the thought to watching TV shows. He closes by calling the thinking a “fun train of thought”. The clip ends with a declaration that the speech was an entry to a diary.

The audio begins with a male speaker explaining something, noting, "...it might confirm that the SCP-3008-1 is a portal." He continues explaining that it might be a portal to other dimensions or galaxies with other people. Then he says that the area could be a wormhole. He continues with an upbeat speaking style, remarking that it is "pretty neat". He continues speaking in the same tone. As he finishes his talking points, music begins to play. The music is mellow and sounds like it is in the jazz genre. The instruments consist of a keyboard and a flute.
